story: The 2025 Grammys are shaping up to be a party. The Recording Academy announced the lineup of performers at the 2025 Grammys on Jan. 24, about a week before the Feb. 2 ceremony.
Sabrina Carpenter, Billie Eilish and more nominees were among the first batch of performers named, with more joining after additional announcements on Jan. 29 and Jan. 31.
Read on for the full list of performers at the 2025 Grammys announced so far, plus their nominations.
Benson Boone
This is the first time "American Idol" alum Benson Boone has been nominated for a Grammy.

Thanks, in part, to his inescapable song “Beautiful Things,” Boone is up for best new artist this year alongside Sabrina Carpenter, Doechii, Khruangbin, Raye, Chappell Roan, Shaboozey and Teddy Swims.
Billie Eilish

Nine-time Grammy winner Billie Eilish is up for seven awards this year: record of the year, album of the year, song of the year, best pop solo performance, best pop duo/group performance, best pop vocal album and best dance pop recording. "Birds of a Feather" was the standout from her May 2024 album "Hit Me Hard and Soft."
Chappell Roan
Like Boone, Chappell Roan has also been nominated for the first time this year.
The "Good Luck, Babe" singer is up for record of the year, album of the year, best pop vocal album, song of the year, best new artist and best pop solo performance.
Charli xcx

Charli xcx's sixth studio album "brat" led to eight Recording Academy nods: album of the year, record of the year, best pop duo/group performance, best pop solo performance, best dance/electronic album, best dance pop recording, best recording package and best music video.
In addition to racking up Grammy nominations, Her album also launched the phenomenon known as "brat summer."
Doechii
Doechii joins Chappell Roan and Benson Boone as a first-time Grammy nominee.
The "What It Is" rapper could potentially take home an award for best new artist, best rap album and best rap performance.
Raye

Raye, born Rachel Keen, became the artist to secure the most wins in one night at the Brit Awards' history last year. She's nominated for the Grammy for best new artist, as well as the songwriter of the year and non-classical and best engineered album, non-classical for her work in Lucky Daye’s album “Algorithm.”
Sabrina Carpenter

Like the other performers at the 2025 Grammys, Sabrina Carpenter has had a breakthrough year in music. The "Espresso" singer has been nominated for record of the year, album of the year, song of the year, best new artist, best pop solo performance and best pop vocal album.
Shakira
If Shakira's performance is anything like the one she gave at the 2020 Super Bowl alongside Jennifer Lopez, then you know it's going to be memorable.
The "Hips Don't Lie" singer has already won three Grammys in her storied career and she could possibly take home another if she wins best latin pop album for her work in "Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran."
Teddy Swims
This is the first year Swims has been nominated for a Grammy. Thanks to his bop "Lose Control," he's up for best new artist.
Brad Paisley
Brad Paisley is a three-time Grammy winner. He made his Grammy stage debut in 2001 when he performed his hit song “We Danced.”
Brittany Howard
Brittany Howard has five Grammys under her belt and she could possibly win one more. At the 2025 Grammys, she's nominated for best alternative music album for her second solo studio album "What Now."
Chris Martin
Colplay's Chris Martin will grace the Grammys stage this year. The 2024 "Moon Music" was their first album in 10 years to top the Billboard 200 chart.
Cynthia Erivo
Erivo, who is close to becoming an EGOT winner, has won one Grammy in her career. The "Wicked" star took home the award for best musical theater album for “The Color Purple" in 2017.
Herbie Hancock
The jazz musician has 14 Grammys and was honored with the Recording Academy's Lifetime Achievement Award in 2016.
Jacob Collier
Jacob Collier is up for three Grammys this year. He's been nominated for album of the year, best global music performance and best arrangement, instrumental or a cappella.
Janelle Monáe
Janelle Monáe has taken the Grammys stage before. The 10-time nominee first took the stage in 2011 and has appeared more times since.
John Legend

John Legend has been nominated for three Grammys this year. He's up for best children’s music album for "My Favorite Dream," best arrangement, instruments and vocals for "Always Come Back" and best arrangement, instrumental or a cappella for "Bridge Over Troubled Water."
Lainey Wilson
Lainey Wilson won first Grammy for best country album for "Bell Bottom Country" in 2024. She's up for the same award in 2025 for her album "Whirlwind."
Sheryl Crow
Sheryl Crow is a nine-time Grammy winner, who was also inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.
St. Vincent
This year, St. Vincent has been nominated for four Grammys — best rock performance, best rock song, best alternative music album and best alternative music performance.
Stevie Wonder

The legendary musician has won 25 Grammys in his career. Wonder is one of three artists to have won album of the year three times. He shares the feat with Paul Simon and Frank Sinatra. Taylor Swift has the most wins with four.
Shaboozey
The Recording Academy announced the addition of Shaboozey to the performers' lineup on Jan. 31.
Shaboozey is up for five awards at the ceremony, including song of the year for his hit "A Bar Song (Tipsy)" and best new artist.
Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars
Grammy-winning stars Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars are set to perform Sunday, the same night their duet, "Die With A Smile" is up for two awards — song of the year and best pop duo/group performance.

title: Shemar Moore and girlfriend Jesiree Dizon announce breakup after 5 years together
summary: Shemar Moore and his girlfriend, Jesiree Dizon, confirm rumors that they've broken up and reveal how they plan on raising their daughter in the future.
story: Shemar Moore and his girlfriend, Jesiree Dizon, have broken up.
On Jan. 31, Moore took to Instagram to confirm rumors that he and Dizon, who is the mother of his 2-year-old daughter, Frankie, are no longer together after five years.
"So the press release was that me and Jesiree are no longer a couple and we live separately, that we've broken up," he said. "Well, it's true."
After asking his fans to be kind amid their breakup, Moore then reflected on his relationship with Dizon going forward.

"Me and Jesiree love each other. That's not going to change until the day God calls my name. Ain't going to change," he said. "She's wonderful in so many ways. Yes, we have our differences, but we're going to love each other and we're going to love the hell out of our daughter, Frankie. She's a phenomenal mother."
Moore added that he and Dizon are "loving friends." The "Criminal Minds" star explained that he and Dizon are going to co-parent their daughter moving forward.

"We're going to co-parent, and we're going to go to ballet, soccer, basketball, Disneyland, the water park, whatever — we're going to do all that because it's not about anything but the children," he said.
"We're just going to live life a little differently," he added.
Along with Frankie, Dizon is also a mom to two older kids, Kaiden and Charli, from previous relationships.
Dizon shared a statement about the breakup to her Instagram account.

"Although our reality has changed, what will ALWAYS remain is the love and respect Shemar and i both have for each other," she said. "'Til God calls our name.' Our commitment is not only to keep our love for each other alive and strong through the best friendship, but by also being the BEST co-parents in continuing to raise our daughter, Frankie, and Kaiden and Charli.

"As Shemar said, breakups aren’t easy, ESPECIALLY publicly so we ask that you please continue to give us love and grace as we navigate our new reality and respect our privacy to allow us to heal," she continued."

title: WWE's star-studded Royal Rumble is here. What to know
summary: WWE will hold the Royal Rumble 2025 event on Saturday, Feb. 1, in Indianapolis. Here's the card, who will compete in the Royal Rumble matches and how to watch.
story: One of the most anticipated WWE events of the year, the Royal Rumble, will take place Saturday night, Feb. 1, at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.

The Royal Rumble is both the name of the event and the name of its signature men’s and women’s matches. A Royal Rumble match begins with two superstars in the ring, with an additional competitor entering every 90 seconds thereafter. The goal is to toss the other superstars over the top rope.
The winners of the men’s and women’s Royal Rumble matches will earn a championship match at WrestleMania 41 at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas, scheduled for April 19 and 20.
This year’s Royal Rumble event will also feature Cody Rhodes defending his Undisputed WWE Championship in a ladder match against Kevin Owens.
Read on to learn more about the 2025 edition of the Royal Rumble, including how to watch.
When is the Royal Rumble 2025?
The Royal Rumble will be held Saturday, Feb. 1, at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis, the home of the NFL’s Indianapolis Colts.
How can I watch the Royal Rumble 2025?
The Royal Rumble streams exclusively on Peacock, beginning at 6 p.m. ET/3 p.m. PT. (Peacock is owned by TODAY.com’s parent company, NBCUniversal.)
What are the Royal Rumble 2025 matches?
Currently, four matches are officially listed on WWE’s website for the 2025 Royal Rumble:

The men’s Royal Rumble match The women's Royal Rumble match An Undisputed WWE Championship ladder match between Cody Rhodes and the challenger, Kevin OwensA 2-out-of-3 falls match for the WWE Tag Team Championship between #DIY and the challengers, Motor City Machine Guns
The men’s Royal Rumble match
The women's Royal Rumble match
An Undisputed WWE Championship ladder match between Cody Rhodes and the challenger, Kevin Owens
A 2-out-of-3 falls match for the WWE Tag Team Championship between #DIY and the challengers, Motor City Machine Guns
Which superstars will take part in the Royal Rumble 2025 matches?

The men’s Royal Rumble match will feature John Cena, who is in the midst of his farewell tour with WWE as he prepares to retire from wrestling this year. He’ll join these other names who’ve been announced for the match: Roman Reigns, CM Punk, Seth “Freakin’” Rollins, Drew McIntyre, Sami Zayn, Shinsuke Nakamura, Logan Paul, Jey Uso, Penta, Bron Breakker, Chad Gable, Rey Mysterio, Damian Priest and Jacob Fatu.

The following superstars have declared for the women's Royal Rumble match: Bayley, Liv Morgan, Bianca Belair, Naomi, Nia Jax, Charlotte Flair, Lyra Valkyria, Ivy Nile, Raquel Rodriguez, Iyo Sky and Candice LeRae.
Are Royal Rumble 2025 tickets still available?
As of this writing, tickets are still available on Ticketmaster's website at $100 and above.

title: What is the ‘Paradise’ plot twist everyone is talking about?
summary: From the creator of “This Is Us” and “Crazy, Stupid, Love,” Dan Fogelman's Hulu drama starring Sterling K. Brown and James Marsden includes a wild plot twist.
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for “Paradise.”
“Paradise” is the latest show to captivate audiences with its unexpected twists and turns.

From the creator of “This Is Us” and “Crazy, Stupid, Love,” Dan Fogelman is no stranger to plot twists that leave viewers wanting more. His latest Hulu drama starring Sterling K. Brown and James Marsden is no different.

The first three episodes of “Paradise” were released earlier than expected, with the first episode airing on Jan. 26 followed by the other two episodes on Jan. 28. The first episode, titled “Wildcat is Down,” ended with a shocking discovery that people did not see coming.
Read on to learn more about “Paradise” and the plot twist at the end of the first episode.
What is 'Paradise' about?
“Paradise” is an eight-episode drama-thriller centered around Special Agent Xavier Collins (Brown), a man who is assigned to protect former President Cal Bradford (Marsden).
In the first episode it's revealed that Bradford has been killed and Collins, a single father of two, is soon made the No. 1 suspect.

Throughout the investigation into president's murder, there are flashbacks of when Collins was first selected by President Bradford to protect him in office. It also shows their complex relationship over the years, including Collins taking a bullet for Bradford and their argument just hours before the former president's death.
What is the plot twist in Episode 1 of 'Paradise'?
The season premiere begins with a bit of foreshadowing as Special Agent Collins greets his neighbor Carl and says, “A little chilly this morning, huh?”
Carl says, “It’ll warm up soon,” to which Collins replies, “Always does.”
Their seemingly innocent conversation is a subtle indication that in their town, everything is always on schedule.

Viewers are able to connect the dots by the end of the first episode during a flashback where General Curtleigh (Scott Lawrence) tells Collins that he will be learning top secret and highly-classified information.

“We are preparing for a massive catastrophe that could cause an extinction-level event for humanity in the very near, very real future,” the general tells Collins in the Oval office. “In preparation, we have begun construction underneath a mountain in Colorado.”
He says that when completed, it will be their only chance of survival and “the world’s largest underground city.”

Meanwhile, in between scenes in the present day, Collins is seen running through a picture-perfect town with advanced technology and fake ducks. It’s noted on a sign that dawn is delayed by two hours.
It ends with Collins looking up at the sky, only for viewers to discover that he is already living in the underground bunker.
When does 'Paradise' air?
The second and third episodes share more about tech billionaire Samantha “Sinatra” Redmond’s (Julianne Nicholson) backstory. It also shows Collins being interrogated after Bradford is found dead.

While a formal investigation in underway, Collins is also seen trying to find answers about the president’s death. This includes speaking to his therapist Dr. Gabriel Torabi (Sarah Shahi) and others who may offer insight.

The season is expected to involve more twists and reveal more secrets. New episodes of “Paradise” will air weekly on Hulu on Tuesdays. Episodes are also expected to air on ABC and FX. Check your local listings.

title: The Property Brothers’ star-studded show ‘Celebrity IOU’ is back — what to know
summary: The "Property Brothers" stars Jonathan and Drew Scott have a new season of HGTV's "Celebrity IOU." Here's the premiere date for Season 9, plus how to watch and details on celebrity guests.
story: A new season of the Property Brothers' show "Celebrity IOU" means more sledgehammers, more celebrities and more fun.
Drew and Jonathan Scott are bringing back their beloved HGTV series with a new season starting on Monday, Feb. 3, which will feature six new episodes each focused on a different A-list celebrity.

In Season 9 of  "Celebrity IOU," the Scott brothers, who executive produce the show, will take on remodeling challenges to help celebrities give back and express gratitude in the form of drastic home transformations.

“I tell people every day that Drew and I have the greatest job in the world,” Jonathan Scott said in a press release. “We feel lucky that we’re able to give these Hollywood powerhouses an opportunity to share a side of themselves you don’t usually see, while also changing someone’s life.”
Here's what to know about the upcoming season of the Property Brothers' "Celebrity IOU."
What is “Celebrity IOU” about?
"Celebrity IOU" stars Drew and Jonathan Scott, aka the Property Brothers, as they work with A-list celebrities to give back to loved ones by revamping their living spaces.
Each episode spotlights a new celebrity with a different vision for their family member's or friend's home.

“Part of what makes Celebrity IOU great is that the stories are so unique and diverse,” said Drew Scott in the release. “The celebrities have known their loved ones for years, so there’s a lot of history there. They get the satisfaction of doing something for someone they love, and it feels amazing that Jonathan and I get to be the conduits for that.”

The Scott brothers will work on a variety of renovations, per the press release, which includes "a detached garage turned California coastal living room and an outdated kitchen transformed with design elements like terrazzo and herringbone wood floors."
When does the new season premiere?
The new season of "Celebrity IOU" will premiere on Monday, Feb. 3, at 9 p.m. ET.
How to watch “Celebrity IOU”
New episodes for Season 9 will air every Monday at 9 p.m. ET on HGTV, and they will simultaneously stream on MAX and discovery+.
Which celebrities are featured in this season?
This upcoming season of "Celebrity IOU" features a star-studded cast, starting off with Rob Lowe in the premiere episode.
Following Lowe, the celebrity lineup is Courteney Cox, Andy Garcia, Goldie Hawn, Kyle MacLachlan and Sarah Silverman.
What other shows do the Property Brothers have?
Besides "Celebrity IOU", the Property Brothers have multiple shows centered around home remodeling and real estate.
Their namesake show, which premiered in 2011 and ran for 14 seasons, is what propelled them to stardom.

Since then, the twins have been building their TV empire, with "Celebrity IOU" but also other shows like "Brother vs. Brother," "Property Brothers: Forever Home" and "Don't Hate Your House," to name a few.

title: Charli XCX alluded to Grammys snubs on this song from 'Brat.' Now, she's up for 8 awards
summary: Charli XCX is set to perform at the 2025 Grammy Awards on Feb. 2. She's up for 8 awards at the ceremony.
story: Charli XCX is set to perform at the 2025 Grammy Awards on Feb. 2, but gracing the Grammys stage is a moment the singer has been thinking about for much, much longer.
The 32-year-old pop star received her first solo Grammy nominations last year, scoring eight nominations tied to her album "Brat," including album of the year and record of the year.
The nominations come more than a decade after the release of her debut studio album in 2013, and 10 years after she received two nominations for her feature on Iggy Azalea's hit song, "Fancy."

Charli XCX has questioned her lack of mainstream success over the years, especially after the release of her 2022 album, "Crash," which became her first album to top the U.K. chart, and debuted at No. 7 on the Billboard 200 chart in the U.S. — her highest charting album at the time.

"me not being nominated for a grammy for crash is like mia goth not being nominated for an oscar for pearl and only further proves that people don’t wanna see hot evil girls thrive," Charli XCX wrote in a post on X in 2023.

It was "Brat," Charli XCX's neon green club record released on June 7, 2024, that finally brought the singer into the mainstream, as her longtime supporters (angels) and newfound fans (brats) came together to make "brat summer" inescapable in 2024. The record debuted at No. 3 on the Billboard 200, becoming her highest charting album of all time.
The Grammys announced Charli XCX would be performing at the awards ceremony at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles on Feb. 2, though no further details about her performance have been revealed.
In one song from "Brat," the singer imagined an eventful night out at Staples Center, the former name of Crypto.com Arena and the location of more than 20 Grammy Awards ceremonies since 2000.
'Spring Breakers' and the Grammys

On "Spring Breakers," the last track on the deluxe version of "Brat," Charli XCX sings about going "spring breakers," a tongue-in-cheek reference to the 2012 film starring Selena Gomez, Vanessa Hudgens and Ashley Benson as a group of college students attempting to take a spring break trip in Florida.

The film was widely panned after its release and has a 38% audience score rating on Rotten Tomatoes. Charli XCX's own 2016 "Vroom Vroom" EP was compared to the film in a review published by Pitchfork, which gave her EP a 4.5 out of 10 rating.

"'Spring Breakers' is a good litmus test here: If you were a fan of Harmony Korine’s 2012 exploitation flick, you’ll probably love the intentional shallowness and plasticky transgression of 'Vroom Vroom,'" the review states. "If (like me) you would have walked out had you not spent $18 on a ticket, you’ll probably hate it."
In another reference to the film, the backing beat of Charli XCX's "Spring Breakers" samples "Everytime" by Britney Spears, which plays at a pivotal scene in the movie.
In the first lines of her song "Spring Breakers," Charli XCX seemingly alludes to her lack of nominations and invitations to awards shows.
"Hi, it’s me, you’re all in danger/ Never get invited ‘cause I’m such a hater," she sings, before warning she has her finger on a detonator.
"Every time, I make it so outrageous/ Always gonna lose to people playin’ safer," she says in the song. "Four, three, two, one, see you later/ Crazy girl s---, gonna go spring breakers."
In the first verse of the song, Charli XCX details how she would arrive at the ceremony, parked outside watching the nominees walk the carpet.

"Vroom, vroom, vroom, vroom, in a big pink truck/ February 10th, and I’m gonna pull up," she says, in a reference to her hit song "Vroom Vroom," as well as the exact date of Grammy Awards ceremonies in 2008, 2013 and 2019.
"Hey, Staples Center, what the f--- is up?/ Yеah, I’m parked outside watching all the girls strut," she continues, referencing the former name of Crypto.com Arena.
In the next few lines, the song takes a dramatic turn, as she warns the nominees not to slip on the red carpet, because she "poured a load of gasoline on the carpet."
"Lit a cigarette, took a drag, then I just flicked it/ Place went boom, boom, boom, boom, clap," she sings, in reference to another one of her hit songs, "Boom Clap."
"Who cares? Just put me on the platform, turn the microphone on/ There’s no one I wanna thank out there, yeah," she sings, before the chorus starts up.
In contrast to her imagining of an explosive entrance to the awards show, Charli XCX offers a different perspective on what she would do if she won an award in the song's second verse.
"On the flip side, I could talk real, real nice/ Maybe if you give me that prize," she sings. "You might see a tear from my eye/ Might change my whole damn life."
"I’d maybe thank God on the stage/ Yeah, I swear I’d be so nice. No, I’d never misbehave/ And I’d do my speech on time, maybe somethin’ just like," she continues.
There's no word yet on what Charli XCX will sing when she takes the stage at the awards ceremony.
Would she sing "Spring Breakers" for her first performance at the Grammy Awards? Probably not. But some fans hope so anyway.
"i know it’ll never happen but i need charli to perform spring breakers at the grammys," one X user posted.
"A spring breakers performance at the grammys would fix me in ways unthinkable," another wrote.

summary: Who's in the "Love Island All Stars" Season 2 cast? Here's what to know, and who's still in the villa.

Season 2 of "Love Island All Stars" comes just months after "Love Island USA"'s sixth season went viral for its must-see moments, memorable contestants and romantic escapades.
